intro: Coussarea chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí coussarea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stem and clusters of small, fragrant flowers. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth, glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
